Papers of George William Childs
1889-1892

See the
Univeristy of Virginia Library’s use policy.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Papers of George William Childs, Accession #6819 , Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was given to the Library on June 19, 1962.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: The papers consist chiefly of letters to Childs in thanks for copies of "Recollections" and "The Stratford Upon Avon Memorial Fountain to Shakespeare." There are very brief mentions of the Philadelphia Public Ledger,the Commercial Bulletin,and Lippincott's Magazine,hopes for fairer treatment of American Indians, U.S. Grant's travels in Grenada and Peking, memorial church windows in London, the common bond between England and the U. S., and portraits of Union generals at West Point.

did.unittitle: George Williams Curtis to George William Childs 1889 Jan 5

scopecontent.p: Thanks for almanac; mentions Public Ledger.

did.unittitle: Hamilton Fish to G. W. C. 1889 Dec 26

scopecontent.p: Thanks for book [ Recollections of General Grant] and inscription of friendship

did.unittitle: Edward John Phelps to G. W. C. 1890 Feb 25

scopecontent.p: Appreciation of book; mentions [Henry] Irving's speech, [Oliver Wendell] Holmes' poem, and [James Russell] Lowell's letter

did.unittitle: [James Willis?] Patterson to G. W. C. 1890 Apr 6

scopecontent.p: Praises G. W. C. 's Recollections; recommends sending a copy to Mrs. Joel B. Erhardt, daughter of Judge Jewett

did.unittitle: Julia D. Grant to G. W. C. 1890 Apr 8

scopecontent.p: Thanks for book and dedication

did.unittitle: Julia D. Grant to G. W. C. 1890 Apr 15

scopecontent.p: Recounts Mrs. Dent's reading his book on Grant to her, and expresses gratitude and praise

did.unittitle: Curtis Guild to G. W. C. 1890 Apr 15

scopecontent.p: Thanks for book on Grant with inscription. Mentions [Oliver Wendell] Holmes, [Thomas Bailey] Aldrich, [Sir Henry Morton] Stanley, [Edwin Percy] Whipple, and [Tom Brown] Hughes. Plans to change size of Commerical Bulletinand write an editorial on G. W. C.'s book.

did.unittitle: Morris Phillips to G. W. C. 1890 Apr 15

scopecontent.p: Thanks for book; will ask son to review it.

did.unittitle: Annie B. Dent to G. W. C. 1890 Apr 15

scopecontent.p: Thanks for book; read it to Mrs. Grant. Recommends it as instructive for men educated at West Point

did.unittitle: Robert Underwood Johnson to G. W. C.

scopecontent.p: Thanks for copy of Recollections; sent to Century

did.unittitle: William Winter to L. Clarke Davis 1890 Apr 21

scopecontent.p: Received Child's book. Requests a copy and inscription for the Arthur Winter Memorial Library

did.unittitle: Horace Porter to G. W. C. 1890 Apr 23

scopecontent.p: Received Recollections and sketch of U.S. Grant. Mentions own speech at West Point

did.unittitle: John Habberton to G. W. C. 1890 Apr 25

scopecontent.p: Thanks for Recollections and inscription

did.unittitle: Edward Dow Giffin Prime to G. W. C. 1890 Apr 30

scopecontent.p: Thanks for book; will send volume of Family Records

did.unittitle: Hamilton Fish to G. W. C. 1890 May 3

scopecontent.p: Thanks and praise for book

did.unittitle: Henry Coppee to G. W. C. 1890 May 7

scopecontent.p: Thanks for book and inscription

did.unittitle: Ellen M. Hutchinson to G. W. C. 1890 May 9

scopecontent.p: Thanks and appreciation for book

did.unittitle: Annie Fields to G. W. C. 1890 May 20

scopecontent.p: Thanks for book. Refers to treatment of the Indians

did.unittitle: William E. Curtis to G. W. C. 1890 May 22

scopecontent.p: Thanks for book and inscription; had read it in article form in [ Lippincott's] Magazine

did.unittitle: Elizabeth C. Agassiz to G. W. C. 1890 Jun 12

scopecontent.p: Thanks for book

did.unittitle: Reverdy Johnson to G. W. C. 1890 Jun 18

scopecontent.p: Thanks for book

did.unittitle: George W. Knight to G. W. C. 1890 Jun 23

scopecontent.p: Praises Recollectionsand U.S. Grant. Refers to presentation of portraits of three Union generals to West Point. Mentions Shakespeare Fountain at Stratford, memorial windows at Westminster and St. Margaret's, and childhood in Oxford. Discusses common bond between America and England.

did.unittitle: James R. Young to G. W. C. 1890 Jun 23

scopecontent.p: Thanks for book

did.unittitle: Lucy H. Hooper to G. W. C. [1890] Aug 29

scopecontent.p: Thanks for book on the Shakespeare Fountain at Stratford, and notice of Mr. Hooper in Public Ledger.

did.unittitle: A. E. Edwards to G. W. C. 1890 Aug 12

scopecontent.p: Thanks for "The Story of the Memorial Fountain to Shakespeare"

did.unittitle: Oliver Wendell Holmes to G. W. C. 1890 Aug 22

scopecontent.p: Thanks and praise for book and inscription

did.unittitle: Jesse Seligman to G. W. C. 1890 Sep 8

scopecontent.p: Thanks and praise for book

did.unittitle: Mary Astor to G. W. C. [1890] Sep 14

scopecontent.p: Thanks for book on Shakespeare Fountain

did.unittitle: William Waldorf Astor to G. W. C. 1890 Sep 16

scopecontent.p: Thanks for copy and praise of Recollections

did.unittitle: "Grace Greenwood" [Sara Jane Lippincott] to G. W. C. 1890 Oct 6

scopecontent.p: Refers to her tribute [to G. W. C. ?] and to work on juvenile books; asks that her books be given notice in the Ledger. Mentions J. G. Whittier and Hawthorne

did.unittitle: M. H. Allibone to G. W. C. 1890 Dec 2

scopecontent.p: Thanks for book. Mentions Mr. Whitacker, Lippincott's Magazine, Dr. McConnell, and Hasty [Pudding?] Society

did.unittitle: Madeleine Vinton Dahlgren to G. W. C. 1891 [Mar 19]

scopecontent.p: Thanks for book and inscription. Mentions Lippincott's Magazineand comments on his relations with employees.

did.unittitle: Edward John Phelps to G. W. C. 1891 Apr 2

scopecontent.p: Thanks and praise for Recollections. Mentions [ Public] Ledger.

did.unittitle: Patrick John Ryan to G. W. C. 1891 Apr 5

scopecontent.p: Praise for Recollections.

did.unittitle: Henry Codman Potter to G.W.C. 1891 Apr 6

scopecontent.p: Requests copy of new edition of Recollectionsand praises G. W. C. for furthering cause of international brotherhood.

did.unittitle: James Parton to G. W. C. 1891 Apr 10
Hamilton Fish to G. W. C. 1891 Apr 18

scopecontent.p: Pleased that another edition of Recollectionsis to be published.

did.unittitle: Oliver Wendell Holmes to G. W. C. 1891 Apr 19

scopecontent.p: Comments on G. W. C.'s book and praises his career.

did.unittitle: John Russell Gary to G. W. C. 1891 Apr 30

scopecontent.p: Thanks for book; mentions U. S. Grant in Grenada, and some ivory sent to G. W. C. Mentions Peking and the theft of an ivory cup.

did.unittitle: John Greenleaf Whittier to G. W. C. 1891 May 1

scopecontent.p: Praises G. W. C.

did.unittitle: James Gibbons to G. W. C. 1891 May 15

scopecontent.p: Praises Recollections

did.unittitle: Richard Watson Gilder to 1891 Jun 1

scopecontent.p: Praises G. W. C. to correspondent.

did.unittitle: Theodore L[edyard] Cuyler to G. W. C. 1891 Jun 25

scopecontent.p: Suggests enlarged edition of Recollections. Mentions Benjamin Franklin and "Sam Weller."

did.unittitle: Mary D. Harrison to G. W. C. 1892 Jan 31

scopecontent.p: Thanks and praise for book

did.unittitle: A. G. Curtin to G. W. C. 1892 Mar 19

scopecontent.p: Thanks for copy of Recollections
